website_summaries.verdict: This full-cut parka features a detachable hood and snap flaps to protect against the elements.
pros: Full-cut jacket constructed from polyester microfiber shell with polyester fleece lining
Outer pockets and main zipper have snap flaps
cons: Some complaints of broken zippers and torn seams within a year

customer_reviews.title: Like someone else mentioned
customer_reviews.text: Just received this jacket today. I am pleasantly surprised. I am around 6'1 and around 268 lbs so I chose to order the 3x tall size. Like someone else mentioned, I like my shirts and jackets a little baggy. Like to be able to move around. This jacket provided that for me. Maybe could of been a little more room to move around. The zipper worked perfectly. This has a nice amount of pockets. Has a nice hood. The interior of the jacket feels like it will keep me warm.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Mack

customer_reviews.title: Most disappointing thing I’ve ever received from Amazon👎🏾👎🏾
customer_reviews.text: I dont like the melted zipper, I dislike the missing buttons, I don’t like the holes, I don’t like the dirt that’s about it....
customer_reviews.author: #LAHUoils

customer_reviews.title: Stylish Parka good down to about 20 degrees F
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent value for the dollar. Water resistant fabric, fleece lining, ample room, pockets with snaps, heavy duty zipper, zipper cover with snaps, and a hood. Good quality manufacturing. This has been excellent in weather down to about 20 degrees F. It doesn't have a heavy-enough insulation to work into the below-zero temperatures we frequently get so I'll need to keep my old parka (that this was to have replaced) around for a while longer. This is quite stylish so it is well worth keeping.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred

customer_reviews.title: Happy Camper!
customer_reviews.text: I have held off on writing reviews for most of the products I have ordered over the past few years to give myself ample time to really test the products and see how they hold up. I bought this for a friend from college who is a struggling artist/game designer. I ordered the 6xl and worked perfectly for him not so much for me, LOL! Just included that as a reference to give an idea on the sizing. It has lasted him so far with no problems and bought a gray one for his brother. Hope this helps. God Bless.
customer_reviews.author: pogth

customer_reviews.title: Runs exact so Go Up
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 2XL and a 3XL. I am pleased with the 3XL. I stand about 6' tall and shoulders run about 24" across. The 2XL fits exact and I just think I need a little wiggle room. I am pleased with the warmth of the jacket, the deep pockets, and the warm hood. Great buy!! Now I need a 4XL for my husband. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Shelle

customer_reviews.title: Great for layering!
customer_reviews.text: The zipper tab is flimsy but otherwise a nice jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits just right, but not heavy enough for an arctic expedition
customer_reviews.text: It is not as "heavy" as I expected. Very lightweight, and seemed kind of thin when I got it. I puffed it up a bit in the dryer with a tennis ball, and it was better. It has kept me warm in some quite cold weather, but I believe that below zero degrees (F) it would not suffice. I love the parka length. It is so long that it is somewhat difficult for me to reach to the bottom to zip up the zipper, and I have quite long arms. But I don't mind, because I wanted something long enough to cover a suit jacket. It does that well. Overall I am very happy at the price I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: Matt P.

customer_reviews.title: If Your Zone is 2 for weather, then you will need some real layers!
customer_reviews.text: This is not as warm as a jacket that was needed. We get 40 to 50 F below zero so often. Like was mentioned, sweatshirts will be needed underneath or another warmer jacket. inside this jacket. It does fasten up nicely, so air does not pass through and that is a real plus! Overall the fit is great and the size is great. Because of the wind not passing though it, keeping it. Has a hood that fastens down wonderfully over your wool hat. We are in a valley and we end up with zone 3 weather here. Even zone 4 plants don't make it through the winter here. Not as cold as Canada or Alaska.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: ... recieved this coat and thought well this is a nice coat, and it was until after a bit ...
customer_reviews.text: I recieved this coat and thought well this is a nice coat, and it was until after a bit over a week the zipper broke. I believe I only wore it three or four times for short periods and several teeth from the zipper simply came loose and fell off. I went to unzip and it got stuck, I pulled it back up and checked to make sure that I wasn't catching part of the coat and noted that several teeth were gone. If not for this happening I would have given this coat a four star as it is warm and comfy just cheaply designed apparently.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: The seller says “Free Returns” but when you have to return they are making you pay to return. Selves too short for body size. Color not at all like shown. Waist tie is cheep elastic string you can stretch way out in front of you so it won't hold waist tight to body.
customer_reviews.author: Wendynp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect  for Unpredictable Midwestern Winters
customer_reviews.text: I had a Boulder Creek winter jacket for several years, so when it was time for a winter coat, I immediately searched on Boulder Creek. What's to like? Well, Ample pockets, adjustable cuffs to keep your arms dry, removable hood, with Velcro chin straps, to keep it on as tight or as loose you want. And the coat still looks good with or without the hood attached. I've been comfortable in temperatures hovering in the teens colder, and a sweater or sweatshirt is added. I imagine I will have many good years of staying warm and dry in the winter. Quality and a good price. Can't go wrong
customer_reviews.author: Jukebox Jim

customer_reviews.title: Very good casual cold weather coat.
customer_reviews.text: This is a light weight, warm, and comfortable jacket but the shell does make a crinkle noise when it is cold. That being said it is a good casual cold weather coat but not necessarily for frigid arctic cold. I bought my coat one size larger so that I could wear a fleece hoodie underneath when it gets supper cold and it has been just the right size for that. The pockets are easy to access and are very large to accommodate gloves and extra head gear. One thing I appreciate is that the shoulders are gusseted giving this coat great freedom of movement of your arms.
customer_reviews.author: R  Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased this product to use While on assignment in a very cold location. I was tempted to spend a lot of money on a parka that was advertised to be of very high quality but also was very expensive. Instead I chose to make a value purchase And went with this product. I got exactly what I was looking for. This parka does the job very well without the high price tag.
customer_reviews.author: HHNC66

customer_reviews.title: Great coat from Boulder Creek!
customer_reviews.text: Another great jacket from Boulder Creek. My big and tall husband wore out an earlier version of this coat, so I purchased this coat as a replacement. It is warm, roomy and, according to him, very comfortable. The outer fabric is the biggest difference between this coat and the previous. It appears to be a little more water-resistant, but the fabric is stiffer and makes a rustling sound every time he moves. If you don't care about that, this coat is of good quality for the price, with LOTS OF POCKETS! It's a winner in my book!
customer_reviews.author: Somervell

customer_reviews.title: Nice winter jacket
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at the end of last winter, and I liked it so much that I bought it again this winter. Fortunately, King Size accepted the return of the second garment without a fuss, and so I can say that their customer service is good. The jacket is quite water repellant to keep you dry, and the fleece lining is just enough to keep you warm for most Mid-Atlantic winter days. For extreme cold, layering is necessary. There are a number of handy pockets, and the jacket is good looking. Very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J. Rieder

customer_reviews.title: Hope this helps
customer_reviews.text: Good coat for the money got it for my dad he's probably around 400 right about 5 foot 10 5x was a little snug on him on the waist area stomach area 6X would have nice but they didn't have any so I want with the 7X I know it's not the most expensive coat would have been nice if they had a metal zipper not that we're having a problem yet with the zipper but I just think metal would be better most of all he was happy with it so ps. He says it keeps him warm where in St Louis temperature drops below freezing here in the winter
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My husband is thrilled with this coat!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this coat. Now the first one i had to return..because my husband thought it wasn't very "roomy". I thought it was fine.. But, I sent it back and he decided to get 2 sizes up..He should have went one size, as the back was coming to a point when he first wore it. Since it has settled down. But, he loves it. he wore a hoodie under it in the winter cold cold days, and by itself on other days . He said it's warmer than it looks and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Barb G.

customer_reviews.title: Warm & comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I am at this time very impressed with this coat, this coat is very warm and comfortable. I am a 6'1" 350lbs man and this jacket in 5Xlrg fits me perfect, I have broad shoulders and this fits perfect. I did remove the waist straps that tighten up the waist area, I felt that they made my movement restricted when tightened. This coat has held up well and is fairly water-resistant. The only con I can give it is when it gets cold out the outer shell gets stiff and feels brittle but doesn't tear or break. In all this has so far been a great winter coat, for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a week of regular use. Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: This jacket fell apart from the day I bought it. Got it for a trip to Sapporo and it literally has had all the pockets rip and sheer off. The seam under the arm has ripped open. Regular use has made this jacket unwearable for a weeks use. DO NOT BUY THIS JACKET. Yes it was warm. But you will ruin this jacket from the second you put it on it will begin to fall apart. Wish I bought something worthwhile. I’d give it zero stars if I could. Do.NOT.buy
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: This is a windbreaker, NOT a parka
customer_reviews.text: One would surely freeze to death wearing this outside. Even with 4 layers this is not usable more than a couple days/year, which is not smart. Recommend Duluth Trading mdse or LLBean end of season closeouts to get reliable parka at reasonable price. This jacket is 99% less effective than the emergency foldable jackets people carry in kits for urgent situations.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Not fit for Santa's elfs and it says big and tall
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the return fee.... Sadly this was a gift for my son who is 6'1 with long arms. I am 5'3" and tried on the coat. The arms came 2 inches from my wrist. The zipper was a cheap plastic that would never hold up to daily use. The material itself ŵas also chèap. Sadly this needs to be returned and I am hoping and praying it gets back in time for me to order ànother coat from another retailer. I orderèd an xxl tall. This wouldn't be fit for Santa's elfs. Not worth 1 star
customer_reviews.author: christina

customer_reviews.title: 3XL
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my father as a gift for my father when I realized he did not have a winter coat. It is very difficult to find any coats 3XL in any store, so I took a chance on an online purchase. Dad is a large fellow but not tall, so it's a tad too long. He loves it though. It has lots of pockets. He likes that he has room to move and it is not constricting in any way. It gives him room to wear something thicker underneath if necessary. He really liked the option to be able to take the hood completely off the coat. He absolutely loves it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mains

customer_reviews.title: Nice jacket
customer_reviews.text: Nice jacket and keeps me warm. It is a touch large but good for me since I like things a little on the loose side. Gives me room to move. The only negative comment I have is it is a little "noisy". Meaning when you move you can hear it. This is due to the water resistant material that makes up the shell of the coat. But it does the job, keeps me warm and dry. Hey, I didn't pay for a $200 coat and I didn't get one.
customer_reviews.author: HarleyDude

customer_reviews.title: Great Jacket
customer_reviews.text: I love the jacket, its warm and comfy and worth the amount. The only thing I do not understand is the zipper in one of the pockets. It opens up a slim compartment that could only be used for like a pin or a small flashlight. When I bought the jacket, I thought the zipper was a quick access to the pocket for something like a phone. The zipper is a small, slim compartment that can store something like a flashlight, or something small like keys. I would have preferred a quick access for a phone instead. That is my only issue and not really a complaint. I wish they would explain what they had in mind for that compartment.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Dekker

customer_reviews.title: Comfy jacket for a big guy
customer_reviews.text: As a gentleman of girth, I was very pleasantly surprised at how well this fit. The sleeve length is perfect, and the jacket, when zipped up, is snug without being tight (proper fit) and nice and warm. I ordered this online as I live in Florida now, but had a business trip to Michigan, and it was a great purchase. As a side note to anyone who does backpacking and is looking for a compact jacket, if you fold it up right, this thing rolls into a very nice tight bundle. I strapped it to the bottom of my day-pack I use as a carry on and it was totally out of the way for my trip home.
customer_reviews.author: Khristopher Beck

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight but warm. It is working well for him. Has been -25 here and with gloves, scarf, and hat, he has been comfortable. Inside is very soft. Fabric on outer side could be more water resistant, have to throw it in the dryer when it snows. Bought one size up due to statements in other reviews. This did not turn out to be necessary. Only go up a size if you wear a lot of bulky sweaters or intend to layer. Overall, I am satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at all cost!!
customer_reviews.text: This coat was exceptional in the beginning, but just after the 30 day warranty ran out, the zippers started coming free from the coat. I now have 5 areas where the threading is coming undone, I tried to talk with the seller, but basically, they said tough luck.
customer_reviews.author: BronxDude

customer_reviews.title: Solid buy
customer_reviews.text: Had mine a few months now, wearing daily. It keeps me warm, dry, and comfortable even in sub-freezing temps. I like that it's roomy and has pockets to stash my gloves and beanie and whatever else. The only complaint I have with this is that the zipper holding the hood onto the coat tends to work itself open, so I wish there were some kind of button or retainer to keep that closed so it doesn't start hanging lopsided. I will improvise something, but that could be improved.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Great jacket and great fit! I'm 6'5, 380+lbs. I bought a 4xl based off of customer suggestions, and I'm glad I listened. It fits me just right. The coat even has a draw string on the inside of the waist so that I can tighten it as I get smaller. Very warm, very comfortable. I'm tall, so sleeve length is always an issue for me, but the sleeves on this coat are the perfect length. Awesome coat, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: AJay_89

customer_reviews.title: Feels good... Feels warm...
customer_reviews.text: This parka feels a little bit larger than expected. Just a little. Actually that makes it a little more comfortable to wear. My only issue is that the pockets are a little lower than I am used to but that's not a big deal. The parka is warm, very good while going out on a cold winter day to walk my dog, Maxie. Sometimes he looks at it as if he wished he had one too.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzy John

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, pockets and zippers coming loose from coat.
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing this coat since it arrived in late November. The first thing I noticed was that the threads holding the zipper bottom to the coat were starting to unravel. Also I keep a pair of thin cotton gloves in the pockets and last week I noticed that one of the pockets is coming loose from the coat. We washed it over the weekend, and some of the plastic things on the ends of the elastic strings needed to be glued back together. I like the coat, it is very warm and fits me well. I also like the removable hood. I just wish it had held up better.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wynia

customer_reviews.title: Not for extreme cold temperatures.
customer_reviews.text: Not heavy enough for winter. When I pulled it out it’s very thin. I bought this for my son and he will still need to wear a hoodie or another jacket on very very cold days. The picture shown looked as though the jacket would be nice and warm with plenty of insulation but it doesn’t have that it’s very thin. I’m not happy with this jacket I would buy something else I don’t recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: I bought this in expectation of cold and windy weather ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in expectation of cold and windy weather here in St Louis, but thus far we have rain, warmer than normal temps and flooding. The coat I ordered is huge, but that is what I wanted. $24? Are you kidding? If I only wear it a few times, it was well worth the price. If deep cold hits, I am ready. Update. Cold weather hit. 5 degrees actual, -0 wind chills, coat is holding it all at bay. Deep pockets and lots of them. Still can't believe the price. Having tested it against the elements, coat 1, elements 0. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Tim G

customer_reviews.title: Nice coat but hood to small
customer_reviews.text: I am a big guy and ordered the 4xl big. Perfect fit in length, waist, shoulders and already tested it outside in freezing rain and wind today in Michigan. The hood is too small. It seems like the hood is for a small person. The band with snaps won't go around my neck at all. The draw strings will stretch around my neck but is to tight. Overall nice coat but could use more attention on the hood for larger people.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Not all that warm
customer_reviews.text: I guess it's as much my fault as anyones. There wasn't a "warmth" rating in the ad. It looked like a nice warm coat, and it probably would be for someone living in Atlanta. Alas, I live in North Dakota, so it didn't match my needs. On a really happy note, Amazon refunded my investment and shipping coast!! Yaay, Amazon!!
customer_reviews.author: James J. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Thinner than I'd expected
customer_reviews.text: I like the coat. It has large pockets that fit a portable cd player I like to bring on walks, and a second cd in its case to carry in another pocket. There are a few other pockets as well, but not an inner pocket as I often like for items I want to be sure remain warm. It's thinner than I'd expected, can't be sure yet it will work for the coldest of Midwestern winter weather. It was comfortable in 40 degree Fahrenheit--actually a little warm--but I don't know how it will perform in below 0 temps and with hellacious wind chills.
customer_reviews.author: jimjays

customer_reviews.title: Nice, warm coat!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice coat! It looks to be very good quality. My husband loves the 4 big pockets on front and the hood fits very snug with a velcro closure and elastic ties on each side. The fit is perfect with a little bit of wiggle room. I think this will work out well for him. It seems to be pretty warm too. He just got it today, so we will see how it holds up. Overall, looks nice and well made.
customer_reviews.author: FrancesB

customer_reviews.title: Seems well made
customer_reviews.text: Winter coat. Things I like is the hood and zipper. I dislike the pockets. They offer no warmth whatsoever as the are inside the outer shell with zero insulation. As for size, I got the 4xlt. That always gives me a coat big enough for layers if I need them. This one is too tight a fit for a sweater underneath. I would go an extra size bigger. But without warm pockets I won’t bother.
customer_reviews.author: hmchardy

customer_reviews.title: Great but not perfect. I really like the brand.
customer_reviews.text: I would buy it again. I'm 6'3 300lbs, and my pant length is only 29", meaning I'm all torso and shoulders. The few cons are: 1. Kind of noisy 2. Plastic zipper 3. There were a few threads that I had to cut off when I received the coat. I checked to endure that the threads were properly backstitched and locked in place. It seems as though the final finishing just forgot to trim the remaining threads. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: PeteyJ

customer_reviews.title: Great coat!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, perfect fit - always concerned about poor quality material or ill fitting but this one did NOT disappoint! Purchased for my son who is 6’4” and 255 Purchased a 4xl tall - Sleeves extend to just below wrist and length to top of thigh, ample shoulder room, not restrictive - went up a size to accommodate winter layers This coat was exactly what he was looking for
customer_reviews.author: jan benson

customer_reviews.title: Super Warm in Sub Zero Climate!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our daughter who recently relocated from Florida to North Dakota with her husband where the temperatures are way below zero with the wind chill factor at times! She absolutely LOVES this and says that it keeps her super warm! And it is really cute on her too! The hood is big and has a lot of coverage! We also bought her a pair of Sorrel boots...the only kind to wear in places that cold! Just FYI.
customer_reviews.author: H. Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Mostly what I wanted. I wanted black, but black cost more, can't knock it for me being cheap. good fabric, keeps me warm and dry. Many pockets. Ordered a size larger than I wear just in case because other reviews said a bit small and I would have to agree. I wear a size large and this was supposed to be a XL, and it fits perfectly for an XL.
customer_reviews.author: DWarlord

customer_reviews.title: NIce Coat
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item in a size that was way to big (5X), however, this was on purpose. I used this as the outer layer of my E.C.W.C.S. Clothing. Everything went as expected, except for the hood. It has a strange cut which would not allow it to close using the attached Velcro fasteners, when wearing a balaclava or scarf underneath. It is almost as if the hood was meant for a smaller size coat rather than the 5X that I ordered. Overall it is quite warm and nicely constructed.
customer_reviews.author: KaLaMar

customer_reviews.title: Generous Cut
customer_reviews.text: From reading the reviews I went with a 3XL-Tall as I'm 6'2" and pushing pass 275 pounds, and It was just too big... Returned for a 2XL-Tall and I'm so pleased with it now, great length in the body and in the sleeves too. I wanted a jacket was didn't weigh a ton and wasn't stiff or bulky and this jacket is neither. It is light in weight and is not cumbersome when worn in the car.
customer_reviews.author: T Cro

customer_reviews.title: Great Coat
customer_reviews.text: Contoured too much around the middle, but otherwise a great coat. fits well in shoulders. I think the Chinese/Asian continent as a whole in the garment industry need to learn that Americans are not all "Hollywood cut," Us who work for a living are full sized. Gives great warmth,yet is thin, not bulky. Lots of pocket room.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Not The Best But Good Value
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice coat for the price. Lighter than I expected but warm enough. I'd consider it mid-weight. Decent zipper. Snaps on pockets are just for show. On my old jacket I comfortably carried keys and other valuables under a front snap pocket -- on this coat I can't trust it -- even a light brush unsnaps things. When it's in the 20's the coat sounds like a bunch of bread wrappers. But all in all a decent coat for well under $100.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Walchak

customer_reviews.title: Lovin' it !
customer_reviews.text: I got this jacket in XL and it fit great except the neck was to tight also 1 snap was defective. So I returned it and got another in XXL it's a little big but at least I can snap the neck now ! This jacket makes you warm just by looking at it.. the material has a durable feel and the liner is soft..lots of pockets, I guess the zipper pocket is for a folding knife or a pen as it is quite small.
customer_reviews.author: bobdraft

customer_reviews.title: Actually made for a tall man.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my very tall, slender, hard to fit son. He is very happy with it. The sleeves and torso are actually long enough for him, without being too big around the belly. I was surprised that it was so well insulated for the bargain price. The only thing I would have liked, was a zipper that works from both ends, so it isn't strained when bending. But that is asking a lot for that price.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth C.

customer_reviews.title: Jacket with pockets
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a jacket with pockets so it checked off that box. While not a disadvantage, the jacket is quite warm. I was looking for something a bit lighter and had no way to judge the temperature range that this garment would be best for. We live in Texas and don't need a coat for below freezing temps; just a nice jacket with features.
customer_reviews.author: J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not Plus Shaped
customer_reviews.text: This is a very straight jacket. It's not cut to be smaller at the top and a bit bigger in the gut so be warned if you're not shaped like an actual lumberjack. You're going to end up with poofiness around your neck and it may be a bit confining around the middle. But other than the shape, it looked to be really good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa S

customer_reviews.title: Good simple good-price jacket for big guys/ladies
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my very tall co-worker who is a rather large in the belly. We reviewed costs of big and tall clothing. It is very expensive! But at this price point it was a no brainer. 5x was great for him. It fell below his belly to cover that waist area from the cold without creeping up on him back and front. It is not particularity thick. Medium thickness. Paired up with a hoodie and he was fine this cold winter. Good at repelling water and snow.
customer_reviews.author: David.

customer_reviews.title: Burning love
customer_reviews.text: Wow this a great coat and it's warm despite not much obvious insulation. I was boiling in this thing when it was 30 degrees outside. I forgot my gloves so my hands suffered until I tucked them into the sleeves. I was only wearing a cable knit sweater and tee shirt underneath and jeans. I like the hoodie because I often forget my knit hat. It kept the wind from biting my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie Cutter

customer_reviews.title: Sloppy Details
customer_reviews.text: The first time I put it on and tried to tighten the hood the bungie cord pulled out of the grommet. It's always the small details that get overlooked with China made goods. I used the jacket this week to be out in the frigid weather up north at a funeral and it kept me warm with good layering. I'll have my daughter fix the cord and keep, but I should send back just so they'll feel some financial impact and might make improvements if they care. Buyer be ware.
customer_reviews.author: Pan Man

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pocket lovers
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my guy (6'4" roughly 300 lbs). Here is a direct quote of his actual review: "Quite honestly it fits fantastic and it's really warm but I hate it. I mean it's great and warm it just has way too many pockets and it looks like a chick's jacket." I'm giving it 5 stars because he loved the fit and feel and as a chick I want ALL the pockets.
customer_reviews.author: C. Spaight

customer_reviews.title: Nice jacket
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coat for my son. He loves it. First coat arrived with a white streak in the fabric on the right shoulder. Return and reorder was fast and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Full size and quality material.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an older jacket that was getting a bit tight and wearing out. This one fits as expected as I ordered a X large so that one could wear a fleece jacket under it when the temps get into the single digits here. I and the wife, like the fit and color and it appears to be good quality material. No surprises or negatives to mention.
customer_reviews.author: R. AUDETTE

customer_reviews.title: Repeat Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This jacket fits true to size. The zip out liner makes it very versatile. It’s durable when worn when worn under most conditions. I bought the navy and I love the way it looks. The hood is roomy enough to wear a toboggan inside it in very cold weather for extra warmth. I previously bought this same jacket in a larger size and was very pleased with it. After losing a considerable amount of weight I purchased my new parka in my my new size and am equally pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Gable101

customer_reviews.title: Great fitting jacket
customer_reviews.text: I had hard time finding a large jacket in B&T sizes for my husband. So I tried out this brand. I am so pleased with it. He loves it. It has plenty of room, it repells water, its warm and looks real nice. Its very affordable for the quality you get. I would highly recommend this jacket. Its true to size, stylish and has lots for room
customer_reviews.author: Natalig

customer_reviews.title: Perfect "car coat"
customer_reviews.text: Not too heavy, not too light. Longer than jacket length, but not full length winter coat. Shell seems water proof. I would have given it a fifth star if it had "double" zipper, meaning opening from the bottom once zipped up, which this coat does not have.
customer_reviews.author: Foster

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'3" and weigh in the 220s. Finding things to fit is always a challenge, especially with jackets. Usually sleeves are too short. I bought the jacket in XL and am very happy with it. It is quite warm and comfortable. No fitting problems at all. Price was good and quality is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hipius

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I received this coat damaged (cut marks on the outside back portion) so it’s since been returned. However I still wanted to review it. It seems nice because there are so many pockets however the outter material seems cheap. It feels and sounds like tarp material, not as heavy duty as a tarp, but still same kind of material. It seemed like it would be warm in cold temperatures though I didn’t get to try it out. I’m going to buy a different coat next.
customer_reviews.author: NicoleTee

customer_reviews.title: MY HUSBAND IS SOOO PARTICULAR...
customer_reviews.text: WHAT DID I LIKE ABOUT THIS JACKET? MY HUSBAND IS SO PARTICULAR HE ACTUALLY LOVES IT!! RIGHT THERE THAT SAID LOTS! LOOKS GOOD ON HIM. I DID PURCHASE ANOTHER JACKET FROM THE SAME COMPANY HOWEVER IT WAS A LITTLE TIGHT. BOULDER CREEK MADE IT SO EASY FOR THE RETURN AND REFUND I DEFINITELY WILL CHECK OUT OTHER ITEMS. THANK YOU BOULDER CREEK FOR MAKING BOTH OUR DAY!!
customer_reviews.author: MommaJ

customer_reviews.title: Horrible.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure I've had a piece of clothing so poorly made. Cheep zippers and stitching. Feels like the jacket is going to fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: jptsr1

customer_reviews.title: Great coat for the price.
customer_reviews.text: My nephews are picky about coats. Nothing too bulky. Flexible enough to stuff in a locker. This coat is perfect for them. They both love this coat. It's everything they were looking for in a coat. This is a great quality coat and at a GREAT price! All plus size people know that nice looking plus size coats are in the hundreds $$$, but not this one. I'm SO happy that we ordered this coat "just to see what it was like". I ordered a 3X and a 5X, and I highly recommend this coat.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela H.

customer_reviews.title: Very warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I love this jacket. I got it for my uncle who is a very large and it covered him all the way and is super warm for him! This is important because he often is outside in cold conditions and he needed a very warm coat. The lining was soft and the shell was waterproof and good quality. It's a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jellybean821

customer_reviews.title: Pocket ripped off after 2 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: Liked the size and warmth, but the quality of material used in making this coat is very suspect. Bottom right pocket, where I store my gloves is now ripped off. I don't know how it happened, I don't remember getting it caught on anything, it just ripped. This coat cost 90 bucks and didn't last through one winter. Never buying this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Jon_Danger

customer_reviews.title: Nice Coat
customer_reviews.text: What I was wanting and expecting! Fits fine! Warm! Looks great! My only complaint is that the zipper is hard to get started. Once started it works just fine, but difficult to get started most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Larry L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: All synthetic parka doesn't breathe.
customer_reviews.text: I like the sizing, fit, and quality of the parka. However, I find that it makes me sweat profusely because it is all synthetic material and doesn't breathe or wick away moisture. I am now looking for a replacement that will be more comfortable to wear that is made from some degree of natural fiber.
customer_reviews.author: S Y LEE

customer_reviews.title: Fits good, plenty warm
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived quickly. It is real cold where I live right now, around 0 degrees Fahrenheit and I have been plenty warm wearing this coat. I do not care for the hood on this jacket. It fits too tight around the neck area and when I don't have it on the Velcro straps get in the way. There's a few loose sewing threads throughout the cost, I hope they don't rip out as some others have noted about this coat. And the zipper does not always zip up smoothly. For the money though I like this coat so far.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen V. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my husband who is a big man. He loves this coat. It has a lot of pockets that are deep, which is important to him because he kept losing things out of his old coat's pockets. It is very warm, yet he can move in it. Really good product. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Kaminski

customer_reviews.title: It looks like a good jacket for the price
customer_reviews.text: It looks like this will work out for me. While I've had another more expensive brand for years, I never zipped up much. I was just to warm. I will know more when the winds start to blow and the temps drop but it did alright in the 42 degree weather at the football game that came along with a bunch of rain and sleet. I stayed warm and most importantly dry.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my oldest son he's a pretty big boy and I have a hard time finding clothes, shoes and other stuff to fit them so I ordered this coat, he needed a new coat for winter so when it arrived I tried it on him it almost fit perfectly. It fits everywhere but the sleeves there a little long. My son is about 5' 7" and 250lbs. I ordered him an XL in big. I hope this helps and when purchasing this item.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Too long bought it for Alaska
customer_reviews.text: Too long and too puffy.. Went to my knees shoulders fit perfect but waist and length was like a folded umbrella.. Could have jumped out of a plane and people would have thought I designed a new parachute.. Stupid looking mess..lol glad I brought another coat and left this one in Alaska.. Might fit a polar bear..
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey T. Rue

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and much warmer than I expected. Got it in black and it’s super comfortable and looks great on. Outer shell is a bit noisy but that’s common for the material. Definitely a thumbs up on this purchase. Almost bought it on the King Size website for $128. So happy I decided to look on Amazon before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Perfect winter parka
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect winter parka. The arm length, the fit in the shoulders and the length of the jacket gives full mobility as well as being very comfy. Being 6 foot 3 inches and about 230 pounds this parka is what I was looking for. And the price was just right.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Wow, thank you!
customer_reviews.text: So its really cold and snowing currently where I am from and my husband goes in and out quiet often for work, he loves it he feels very comfortable wearing it and is true to size, its well put together. Theres soft fabric inside and soft fabric on the hood. Well made, completely impressed. My husband cant stop thanking me for this!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Great Coat.. But buy one size larger.
customer_reviews.text: This coat was very well made and worth the price. Glad I read the reviews, because a few had mentioned to buy it one size larger if you do not want a tighter fit. I did order a size larger for my husband and it was the perfect loose fit light I was hoping it would be. He was very happy the fit, with the quality of the jacket... That and that the hood is detachable.
customer_reviews.author: Linnie

customer_reviews.title: Great coat for big man.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this coat for my adult son who is a big boy. He has had it about a year now. He loves it. It’s comfortable and warm. Great pockets and washes well. There was some weak stitching on the front large pocket which is unfortunate. Easily fixed though.
customer_reviews.author: Dannette Myers

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this coat for my father and it fits him perfectly. After reading other reviews I ordered him one size bigger than he normally wears, which resulted in the coat fitting well, but having enough extra room so he can wear multiple layers under the coat if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Good coat
customer_reviews.text: It is very warm. It has plenty of roomy pockets. It had a area that covers the face if desired. This was a gift for an older man for Ohio winters. Though we have only had a few days of cold sonbad he needed it. It did its job famously when he did.
customer_reviews.author: Auntie Nymity

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfy
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about some of the other reviews of this jacket but I took a chance and I'm very glad I did. This jacket is very warm and well-made. It's also sturdy. The only concern is that the jacket is slightly longer than I expected. But, there's no fear of my back being exposed when I'm shoveling or working outside. Overall I love it and am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Berniek

customer_reviews.title: Overall wonderful coat!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I am an overweight female and cant seem to find woman's winter coats I like. If I were an appropriate size it would zip in all the places!! It is very soft on the inside, has a ton of different deep pockets. The sipper seems to be plastic, but I havent had problems with it. The wrists have Velcro on them for adjustability. Its a great coat!
customer_reviews.author: Bouyant_Jester

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Paid approx $40 Jacket is thinner than expected but still warm. Holding up so far, no rips it tears after 4 months. I live in an area with anywhere from 20 degrees to -20 in the winter. Fit is a bit strange (wider shoulders, thinner hips) but this is clearly a man's jacket so that was to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you warm while it last
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty decent jacket that keeps me warm but it's very poorly made. Within 3 months of using the jacket I noticed a fairly large whole in the armpit seam of the jacket. I also found that the pockets are filled with loose threads. I haven't had any issues with these threads getting pulled and damaging the pockets but they can get in the way when trying to use the pockets.
customer_reviews.author: D. Steil

customer_reviews.title: excellent wind breaker BUT NOT A WINTER COAT!
customer_reviews.text: Hardly insulated, froze my azz off in it. Would make for a great raincoat though BUT NOT A WINTER COAT!
customer_reviews.author: jerry

customer_reviews.title: Winter coat
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for me after a friend had told me about a guy who lost everything.tools clothes and did not have any winter clothes and needed a winter coat. So I fouond one and gave it to him and he was so surprised that he was lost for words. so I turned around and ordered me one and I love it. I reccomend this coat to any one who needs one that will keep the wind out and this does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: satisfied buyer
customer_reviews.text: The only real complaint is made by my wife who says the outside material tends to wrinkle in the seat area and allows the lining to curl around and be exposed. Perhaps outside material could be a tad heavier which might stop this. Otherwise is as expected.
customer_reviews.author: swede620

customer_reviews.title: Good wind-breaker
customer_reviews.text: I definitely need to layer this over a jacket for added warmth here in the Midwest, but this is very comfortable and does keep the wind from chilling my bones.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great coat for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Purchasing anything clothing related for my husband, without trying on before hand.... is never a good idea. He’s about 6’3” and roughly 340 pounds. We initially tried the 6 XL but ended up returning that for the 5 XL in case he wanted to wear a hoodie underneath. It’s the perfect length all the way around. Very pleased with the price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with size and quality
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of buying coats and getting windbreakers instead! This is actually what you would expect as a coat but it isn't so poofy that you look like the Pillsbury dough boy. It is not arctic but it is suitable for winter up north.
customer_reviews.author: C.wiggins

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Coat
customer_reviews.text: Great coat for the price. It will definitely keep you warm. Great fit in my case that I wear extra layers under the coat. Some people might find it too loose but it would depend on your taste. If you don't wear extra layers like I do it is still warm. Not heavy at all and it doesn't feel cheap or badly manifactured.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for big and tall guys.
customer_reviews.text: Great price! Bought this jacket on a black-Friday sale and what a buy. It’s so warm and with plenty of storage. My only real complaint is that the pockets don’t have a similar lining to that if the inside of the Parka. Just plain fabric, which doesn’t keep your hands very warm. Overall it’s a great fit however, and extra long as I’m really tall.
customer_reviews.author: Preston Reyome

customer_reviews.title: AN ATTRACTIVE COAT AND A MARVELOUS FIT!
customer_reviews.text: This coat fits me just right! I am 6'2 and 320 lbs. ... I ordered it in a 4X Tall... (the Tall gives me a little extra coverage against the cold)! I am very pleased with the fit! It's roomy enough for a coulpe layers of stuff underneath but so big that you feel you coud swim in it! I also like gray contrasting lining!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Alittle right in the shoulders but good everywhere else. I would not call it heavyweight though. Good for below freezing but not if you go below 20F or lower. Up by Chicago we get some nasty wind chills so we will see how this handles that. But for the price, I can’t complain.
customer_reviews.author: Tim M

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Jacket was only used for less than a month, when a tear appeared under the armpit area. By the end of winter, huge tears under both armpits. Hardly worn, only a handful of time. Work from home so don't go out that often and didn't have a very cold winter overall
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Sikora

customer_reviews.title: Great coat at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 8X because I’m extremely fat and hemiplegic (paralyzed on the left side due to stroke). This has lots of room to wrap up in and keep warm. Soft and warm fleece lining. Big pockets, and snaps up in front for my ease of entry/exit. I look forward to many cozy winters to come, thanks to this coat. Good materials and good construction.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Deeley

customer_reviews.title: Fine for an older man.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my husband who is "homebound" with various disabilities and who needed a longer length coat due to his size. He will only need the coat for four or five trips out of the house a month and it seems fine for this purpose. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jdodyd

customer_reviews.title: Piece of trash!
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is a total piece of trash. DO NOT waste your money. The fabric is so slick and loosely woven, it doesn't even feel like fabric -- more like a sheet of plastic. The underarm seam ripped out after several wearings. Then, when I decided to return and ask for refund, I found that the window for return had passed. No surprise!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Sue

customer_reviews.title: Not very heavy weight
customer_reviews.text: My Husband is 6'4" with long arms. The jacket fits the way my husband wanted it to- long enough sleeves and a little loose so he could add layers. Unfortunately, it's rather thin for temperatures below the teens. Also the shell material is very noise, especially when cold.
customer_reviews.author: S&S

customer_reviews.title: Great Deep Winter Parka, Top Quality, Luxurious Soft Feel, At A Bargain Price!
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this product says Top Quality and Top Comfort. It is purely intended for those really cold days... AT OR BELOW ZERO... not ''very chilly'' or warmer weather, although KingSize.com and Amazon.com ad images and copy may not lead the consumer to understand this clearly. Quality and Fit are superb in every way, and the feel of the coat is exceptionally cozy and comfortable for such a heavy-duty warmer! Amazon's price is exceptionally good right now (2014/12/05)... about half KingSize's Sale Price... so grab a bargain while its available if you need this type of coat !!!
customer_reviews.author: eNGeeNC

product_meta.title: Boulder Creek by Kingsize Men's Big & Tall Fleece-Lined Parka with Detachable Hood and 6 Pockets Coat
feature_bullets: BIG AND TALL SIZING: You should order Tall if you are 6'2" or taller. You should order Big if you are 6'1" or shorter

The Expedition Parka crushes the competition. It's a microfiber hooded parka with a plush fleece lining for extra warmth. This coat is also equipped with a detachable hood and plenty of pockets, including hand-warmer pockets.
Relaxed fit. Zip-front closure with snap storm flap
Plush fleece lining. Quilted polyfill in sleeves. Detachable hood. 6 roomy pockets; interior pocket

ABOUT THE BRAND: Boulder Creek is prepared for all of the big & tall guy’s adventures. Whether it’s adding a side-elastic waist to our durable cotton twill cargos or adding extra pockets to our jackets, we make sure everything passes the test for reliability, utility, and comfort. Even if your adventures aren’t in the great outdoors, tackle life in gear that’s rugged to the core.
